item.title: Fiber Internet Availability and Lower Prices
item.description:
By: John Shepler It’s time for businesses to switch from traditional wireline internet to fiber optic service. You might be surprised how accessible and affordable fiber internet has become. Fiber Optic Internet: What’s New? A decade ago, fiber optic internet was only for large corporations due to its high cost. The service, primarily offered by major telephone companies, was limited in availability and very expensive. This has changed drastically. Today, Ethernet has become the most popular fiber optic service, with prices comparable to older T1 or T3 lines while offering significantly more bandwidth...

item.title: Two Flavors of Fast Ethernet Service
item.description:
By: John Shepler Don’t let bandwidth restrictions hinder your business growth. There are two budget-friendly ways to obtain 100 Mbps Fast Ethernet service, which is typically sufficient for small to medium-sized businesses. We’ll discuss upgrading to Gigabit Ethernet later. Fast Ethernet over Fiber The leading business bandwidth solution has transitioned from traditional T1 lines to fiber optic service. We’re not referring to the outdated and expensive SONET telco fiber known as OC-3, OC-12, or OC-48, but rather the contemporary Carrier Ethernet standard called Ethernet over Fiber, or Metro Ethernet...
